posts._title: Juan Bustillo Oro – Dos monjes AKA Two Monks (1934)
posts.title: Dos monjes
posts.excerpt: This vividly stylized, broodingly intense early Mexican sound melodrama by Juan Bustillo Oro hinges on an audacious flashback structure. When an ailing monk recognizes a new brother at his cloister, he becomes deranged and attacks him. Dos monjes recounts the men’s tragic shared past once from the point of view of each, heightening the contrasts …

posts.title: Le printemps
posts.excerpt: Nymphs and cupids dance in celebration of the arrival of Spring.

posts._title: Louis Feuillade – Bout-de-Zan vole un éléphant (1913)
posts.title: Bout-de-Zan vole un éléphant
posts.excerpt: A circus is in town so Bout-de-Zan (Rene Poyen) decides to sneak off and see the elephant while everyone else is sleeping. Once there he decides the best thing to do would be to steal it and the two then set off for many misadventures.

posts.title: Aya
posts.excerpt: Two strangers unexpectedly meet at an airport. He mistakenly assumes her to be his assigned driver.She, enchanted by the random encounter, does not hurry to prove him wrong.

posts._title: Cecil B. De Mézig – Esprit de Famille AKA Family Spirit (1948)
posts.title: Esprit de Famille
posts.excerpt: A blonde woman drops by her sister’s apartment unexpectedly and discovers her brunette sister having sex. While hiding behind a curtain, the blonde sister is so aroused that she begins to masturbate and is discovered. Angry that their sexual liaison has been disturbed, the man grabs the blonde and proceeds to spank her and then …

posts._title: Nelson Pereira dos Santos – Vidas Secas aka Barren Lives [+Extras] (1963)
posts.title: Vidas Secas
posts.excerpt: Quote:A poor family in the Northeast of Brazil (Fabiano, the father; Sinhá Vitória, the mother; their 2 children and a dog called Baleia) wander about the barren land searching for a better place to live, with food and work. But the drought and misery destroy their hopes.

posts.title: Mya – la mère
posts.excerpt: About an African mother suckling her two year old child.

posts.title: Cinderella Liberty
posts.excerpt: Quote:This charming tough-love romance is yet more evidence why the early 1970s is considered one of the most creative times in Hollywood. Basically a story about a link-up between a sailor and a pool hall tramp, Cinderella Liberty overcomes traditional problems with such material. The “R” rating for once allows such characters to talk as …

posts.title: Alimony
posts.excerpt: Small town girl Kitty Traves comes to New York with the idea of getting rich fast. Beginning as a ‘model’ she then becomes a divorce co-respondent in hotel room frame-ups. When her songwriting boyfriend, Dan Barker, runs out of songs and money, she send him back to his loyal, true-blue fiancée, Linda Waring. She moves …
